Denser mangrove is a welcome addition. Tall dense trees look great, it makes forests look like actual forests! Wandering trader & village bells really need to be fixed, they still have a lot of glitches. Traders are consistently spawning below village bells deep underground, the Y-range of wandering trader spawn is messed up. Villagers also can't mingle on bells if other villagers can't reach it. Having a lot of job site blocks on your village will also prevent villagers from doing jobs. I hope these issues are fixed!

There are various discussions in the community about exploration, such as going to ancient cities to get swift sneak, going to mansions to get allays... but exploration in bedrock edition is unfortunately very limited. Starting on 16384 blocks, 65536 blocks... you can fall through the world & die. This is marked as "won't fix" by the bug tracker. There are also generation issues the further you go from spawn such as missing mountains. Exploration also bloats save files, and devices like mobile/console have disk space limitations. Large file sizes will also harm performance & cause lag/crashes.

I really want exploration to be infinite in minecraft, keeping players hooked on adventure. If we add temporary, roguelike, randomly generated dimensions that resets after clearing it, exploration can truly be infinite. Like the 2020 april fools update. It will fit well in ender dimension updates. I wouldn't mind extremely rare items, if I can explore infinitely!

It seems in 1.19.30, there's more sculk in the deep dark to match java, which is great! It was too barren and easy.

I think 1.19 is a great update overall. Mangroves are cool. Wardens and ancient cities are great for youtube content creators, and I hope there's more scary mobs and big dungeons in the future! The treasures could be more exciting and unique though.

Really, the biggest issue in 1.19 is the controversy surrounding it, such as chat report and removal of fireflies/birch forest. I was looking forward to those decor items like fungi, hanging moss, pebbles, etc. Partial blocks are essential for decoration!

I just hope that mojang can rectify all the controversy lately by adding popular community requests in the future. You know what those are; dog skins/armor, up-slabs, end update, etc. Popular, highly-rated mods are a great way to see what minecraft players want.

And please stop deleting feedback; you have all these spammy comments in this thread that are not deleted, but genuine feedback kept getting erased. It's very difficult to give feedback here; it seems like the only way to give feedback is to be a big youtuber.

Goat horns are a very cool implementation for player instruments, but I feel they lack any value in a single player world. Being able to stack multiple sounds is intrinsically a multiplayer only feature, unless the shrieker or dispenser is able to play a horn in the future, and even then I feel like most of the appeal exists solely within the space of a multiplayer server where you can play instruments with your friends. Like most features in Minecraft, I think there needs to be some overarching utility to the horns to ensure that they bring some variety or specialty to gameplay.

Personally, I think horns could be a great way for players to call their pets to their location, or since the allays love music, perhaps the horn could be used to stop their noteblock linked behavior or call all loaded allays to the player to make it easier to give them items or remove them from their inventory. I also like the idea of the horn acting as a stun against the warden or skulk sensors, somehow altering their behavior for a short time to allow the player to make a noisy escape.

One minor nitpick is that this seems like a no-brainer addition to smithing tables; horn + copper ingot not only makes sense in the context of the netherite system but also reduces the cost of a tool that currently requires the same number of ingots as a lightning rod.

The allay is a very fun mob with a lot of potential. However, there is still a ton of things I would consider changing about how the allay works.

One thing I would change about the allay is the removal of the 30 second note block timer. The timer is a major obstacle when it comes to allay powered item sorting and automation possibilities. Although at first glance it seems that this problem can be alleviated with the simple application of a redstone clock to the note block to continually update the allay, problems arise when trying to sort items with multiple allay tied to their own note blocks. Having to continually update the allay will cause one allay originally assigned to a noteblock assigned to one item to become reassigned to a note block assigned to an entirely different item, crushing the possibility for the allay to be used in item sorting contraptions. In addition to removing the timer, I would also have the allay ignore all other noteblocks when it is already tied to one. Without this, item sorters would be very difficult to build. Doing these would void the allay of such issues. Allay should be tied to a noteblock up until the point the block is removed.

Another thing I would make sure the allay can do is continue dropping items near noteblock they are assigned to even when the person that gave them the item is far away. Allay should also stay within a radius of the noteblock they are assigned to instead of following the player when he/she leaves the area.

Ideally, they should accurately drop items at hoppers near the noteblocks.

I like the Allay's design so far, but it really needs unique sound effects. We can also give it unique drops, to give the Allay multiple uses. There hasn't been a unique new mob drop in a long time.

The allay as a mob is amazing; however, they are too much of a pain to acquire. In my opinion, you shouldn't have to travel thousands of blocks to find a few allays, then somehow trek them back home; all for a mob that helps you be lazy, then eventually die because they are limited. I think there should be a unique but costly method of breeding them. Here are a few ideas:

- Breeding involving diamonds. Since allays have a certain interest in music, it would make sense for them to be attracted to diamonds considering they are the same color, and diamonds are used to craft jukeboxes. Diamonds are nonrenewable, meaning this would be a significant level of cost to grow the population. Now I don't know how exactly the breeding would work. Maybe it could like other mobs, just right clicking a pair with a diamond. Or it could be a more complex method, requiring multiple conditions like villagers. 

- Some sort of curing process. It's pretty well-known that allays are a counterpart of the vex. So, what if there was a way to convert one to the other. More specifically, vexes to allays. This could include a combination of potion effects and valuable items, similar to the conversion of zombie villagers. Or it could be a combination of conditions that focus on lore. Either way would be intuitive and would definitely make the game feel more immersive.

The allay is such a cool and necessary concept but this iteration would simply not be useful. Resetting the noteblock every 30 seconds is pointless and very annoying. The movement and item collection prioritisation is extremely inconsistent at the moment, which makes it almost totally useless. Grouping items in arbitrary blocks (ex. all wool colours being treated the same) is exactly the opposite of what the allay would be useful for, it makes them less functional than traditional item sorting. The ability to sort non-stackable items was one of the reasons people wanted the Allay in the first place. I think it's really cool that the Allay gives new life to previously underused structures, but there needs to be a way to breed or at least heal them, given how low their health is and how hard they are to control. I propose that XP would be a really unique and cool way of doing this, it avoids the issue of having a special case for some breeding item to give them (since normally right clicking or throwing would just give the item to the Allay), and it also ties in well with some of the themes of this update -- namely giving players new ways to work with XP in skulk. I think the Allay has great promise though and it certainly delivers on the cuteness we saw in the promos!

My thoughts:

1. I think there should be a way to make a specific allay follow you without it holding an item

The allay is great, but I can think of some changes that can be made like adding the sounds, make it dance to the music of note blocks (even though there is a playanimation command, but i would prefer it can have a cute little dance.), make it tameable (using cookies because i think it would love cookies and when tamed, it would have a halo and would follow you everywhere you go.), when holding a sword 
(any material or enchantment) the tamed allays will help you fight the hostile mobs/neutral mobs (when hostile), when the deep dark stuff from java edition come out, a tamed allay can help you out when the warden is around (the allay can find a hiding spot then it will make a certain noise to tell you to follow the allay).

Although I haven't played the beta, I do have a few suggestions as to what the allay could do.

First off, it would be a nice addition if the allay could hum very softly. What would make this feature even better is if they would hum some of the music disks (cat, chirp, 13...oh wait, nevermind on that last one). The allay should have a high-pitched voice that would sound just slightly unsettling. Maybe it should have an echo effect, something that makes it sound otherworldly yet still recognizable. 

Second, (and I know this idea seems far-fetched, but just hear me out) the allay should be able to eat redstone dust. I know sounds idiotic, but listen. Many players don't like or even know how to use redstone. This would make mining for the dust more valuable since it would heal the allay and give redstone a secondary use. Not to mention that you need redstone to craft a noteblock, which, I think, would give a little nod to the crafting recipe. 

Third, and this last one is important, the allay should have idle animations. I know everyone seems to be up in arms about the lack of animations, but those will come later. What I want to see is just a couple of animations the allay does while doing nothing else. Just maybe spinning around in lazy circles, dancing to a tune that it's humming, or just looking around its environment. I know this might be hard for the devs to implement, but it would make the allay truly come alive. 

Anywho, those are my ideas, hope you enjoyed!

There could be an item called the Hardcore Upgrade, where this is obtained by smithing redstone dust on a dragon egg in a smithing table.
